key_title: Key to the species of Verbascum

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Scrophulariaceae

source.author: Barker, W.R.; Harden, G.J.
source.title: Verbascum
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Barker, W.R.; Harden, G.J. (1999). Verbascum. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Bracts and sepals prominently serrate; stamens 4; plant with glandular and eglandular hairs
Bracts and sepals more or less entire; stamens 5
Leaves grey to whitish or yellowish, from a dense woolly to tomentose or sometimes floccose indumentum; inflorescence dense, the flowers and fruits closely packed; basal leaves entire or crenate
Leaves more or less green, glabrous or sparsely hairy
Flowering and fruiting pedicels 10–25 mm long, much longer than subtending bracts; 1 pedicel at each node; basal leaves lobed to toothed, glabrous or almost so

Flowering and fruiting pedicels less than 10 mm long, usually 2–5 mm long and much shorter than subtending bracts; 1–5 pedicels at each node; basal leaves regularly toothed, sparsely hairy to glabrous
